
{{alias}}( k )
    Returns a pseudorandom number drawn from a chi distribution.

    If `k <= 0` or `k` is `NaN`, the function returns `NaN`.

    Parameters
    ----------
    k: number
        Degrees of freedom.

    Returns
    -------
    r: number
        Pseudorandom number.

    Examples
    --------
    > var r = {{alias}}( 2 );


{{alias}}.factory( [k, ][options] )
    Returns a pseudorandom number generator (PRNG) for generating pseudorandom
    numbers drawn from a chi distribution.

    If provided `k`, the returned PRNG returns random variates drawn from the
    specified distribution.

    If not provided `k`, the returned PRNG requires that `k` be provided at each
    invocation.

    Parameters
    ----------
    k: number (optional)
        Degrees of freedom.

    options: Object (optional)
        Options.

    options.seed: any (optional)
        Pseudorandom number generator seed.

    Returns
    -------
    rand: Function
        Pseudorandom number generator (PRNG).

    Examples
    --------
    // Basic usage:
    > var rand = {{alias}}.factory();
    > var r = rand( 5 );
    > r = rand( 3.14 );

    // Provide `k`:
    > rand = {{alias}}.factory( 3 );
    > r = rand();
    > r = rand();


{{alias}}.NAME
    Generator name.

    Examples
    --------
    > var str = {{alias}}.NAME
    'chi'


{{alias}}.PRNG
    Underlying pseudorandom number generator.

    Examples
    --------
    > var prng = {{alias}}.PRNG;


{{alias}}.SEED
    Pseudorandom number generator seed.

    Examples
    --------
    > var seed = {{alias}}.SEED;


{{alias}}.STATE
    Generator state.

    Examples
    --------
    > var r = {{alias}}( 2 )
    <number>
    > r = {{alias}}( 2 )
    <number>
    > r = {{alias}}( 2 )
    <number>

    // Get a copy of the current state:
    > var state = {{alias}}.STATE
    <Uint32Array>

    > r = {{alias}}( 2 )
    <number>
    > r = {{alias}}( 2 )
    <number>

    // Set the state:
    > {{alias}}.STATE = state;

    // Replay the last two pseudorandom numbers:
    > r = {{alias}}( 2 )
    <number>
    > r = {{alias}}( 2 )
    <number>


{{alias}}.STATE_LENGTH
    Length of generator state.

    Examples
    --------
    > var len = {{alias}}.STATE_LENGTH;


{{alias}}.STATE_SIZE
    Size (in bytes) of generator state.

    Examples
    --------
    > var sz = {{alias}}.STATE_SIZE;

    See Also
    --------
